metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2807 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in MozillaFirefox before 46.0, Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.8, and Firefox ESR 45.xbefore 45.1 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code viaunknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
